task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 9°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I am currently facing the target building at approximately 10°N; to estimate its height accurately, I need to look upward to see the full structure from ground to roof.
I am looking up at the building but may not yet see the full height; I will tilt further upward to capture the roofline and ensure accurate height estimation.

I have already tilted up twice and may be near the top of the building; I will now look down slightly to re-anchor the base and estimate height using visual proportion relative to known ground features.
I am now looking slightly downward and can likely see the base of the building; I will tilt up again to reacquire the full vertical span from base to roof for height estimation.

I have now visually bracketed the building’s height by looking up and down; using standard floor height assumptions (~3m per floor) and visible window rows, I estimate the building is approximately 24 meters tall.
